pull.title: test: Remove confusing hash256 function in util
pull.body:
Right now there are two `hash256(bytes)` in the test framework:
first: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/functional/test_framework/util.py#L186
second: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/functional/test_framework/messages.py#L60

While they have the same name they're actually doing different things, one just does a sha256d and the other sha256d and reverses the bytes.
so I renamed the second one to be `hash256_reversed` to signify that it's hash256 reversed.

rename.from: Renaming confusing hash256 function name in the tests
rename.to: test: Renaming confusing hash256 function name

rename.from: test: Renaming confusing hash256 function name
rename.to: test: Remove confusing hash256 function in util

Moved and renamed hash256 from util.py to zmq_interface.py

events.message: Moved and renamed hash256 from util.py to zmq_interface.py

events.body: This is silly, but the new name `hash256_reversed` scared me for a split second - my first association was hash inversion.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16404](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16404.html) (qa: Test ZMQ notification after chain reorg by promag)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

ACK afc0966d725aeeb8842dc264bd48f0e9c41f6a34

Checked that `interface_zmq.py` is still passing. Also updated the PR text with the correct function name `hash256r` -> `hash256_reversed`

comments.body:
wouldn't mind being extra verbose here, since it is only used twice in the code

```suggestion
def hash256_reversed(byte_str):
```
Or maybe just move it to the zmq test, as that is the only place where it is used

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -183,7 +183,7 @@ def check_json_precision():
 def count_bytes(hex_string):
     return len(bytearray.fromhex(hex_string))
 
-def hash256(byte_str):
+def hash256r(byte_str):
     sha256 = hashlib.sha256()
     sha256.update(byte_str)
     sha256d = hashlib.sha256()
comments.body: Looks like you can replace all of this code with `hash256()[::-1]`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -183,7 +183,7 @@ def check_json_precision():
 def count_bytes(hex_string):
     return len(bytearray.fromhex(hex_string))
 
-def hash256(byte_str):
+def hash256r(byte_str):
     sha256 = hashlib.sha256()
     sha256.update(byte_str)
     sha256d = hashlib.sha256()
comments.body:
yeah but then there will be a circular dependencies. (messages already imports util, this will require util to also import messages)

But if I'll move this function to zmq tests then that's possible(or to messages?)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,7 +103,7 @@ def _zmq_test(self):
 
             # Should receive the generated raw block.
             block = self.rawblock.receive()
-            assert_equal(genhashes[x], hash256(block[:80]).hex())
+            assert_equal(genhashes[x], hash256_reversed(block[:80]).hex())
